Prerequisites: ACG2021; ACG2071; QMB3200 (TO ENROLL IN ACG 3341, STUDENTS MUST HAVE COMPLETED ACG 2021 AND ACG 2071, WITH A GRADE OF “B” OR BETTER (“B-” IS NOT ACCEPTABLE). ST
Course Description: THIS COURSE COVERS THE PLANNING AND CONTROL OF ECONOMIC ENTITIES THROUGH COST-VOLUME-PROFIT RELATIONSHIPS, JOB ORDER, AS WELL AS PROCESS AND STANDARD COST ACCOUNTING. EMPHASIS IS PLACED ON THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN ACCOUNTING SYSTEMS AND DECISION MAKING.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
